data.enText: place to sit
a place where you can sit, for example a chair

data.chText: 她坐在那里，往后靠了靠。
data.enText: She sat back in her seat.

data.chText: 他把买的东西放在身后的座位上。
data.enText: He put his shopping on the seat behind him.
Please take a seat (= sit down) .
Ladies and gentlemen, please take your seats (= sit down) .

data.chText: 挨窗户 / 角落里的座位
data.enText: a window/corner seat (= one near a window/in a corner)
a child seat (= for a child in a car)

data.chText: 您想要靠窗的座位还是靠过道的座位？
data.enText: Would you prefer a window seat or an aisle seat ? (= on a plane)

data.chText: 我们坐在一棵老树的树杈上。
data.enText: We used the branch of an old tree as a seat.

data.chText: 我们都默默无语，一个跟一个地回到座位上。
data.enText: We all filed back to our seats in silence.
-seater
with the number of seats mentioned
a ten-seater minibus
an all-seater stadium (= in which nobody is allowed to stand)
part of chair
the part of a chair, etc. on which you actually sit
a steel chair with a plastic seat
in plane/train/theatre
a place where you pay to sit in a plane, train, theatre, etc.
to book/reserve a seat (= for a concert, etc.)
There are no seats left on that flight.
official position

data.chText: （议会、理事会、委员会等的）席位
data.enText: an official position as a member of a parliament, council, committee, etc.

data.chText: 市政会 / 议会 / 国会席位
data.enText: a seat on the city council/in Parliament/in Congress

data.chText: （在选举中）赢得 / 失去一个席位
data.enText: to win/lose a seat (= in an election)
to take your seat (= to begin your duties, especially in Parliament)

data.chText: 理事会的多数席位将由工商界代表担任。
data.enText: The majority of seats on the board will be held by business representatives.
town/city

data.chText: （尤指大学或政府机关）所在地；中心
data.enText: a place where people are involved in a particular activity, especially a city that has a university or the offices of a government

data.chText: 华盛顿是美国政府所在地。
data.enText: Washington is the seat of government of the US.

data.chText: 有学术重镇之称的大学城
data.enText: a university town renowned as a seat of learning
country house
country seat
a large house in the country, that belongs to a member of the upper class
the family seat in Norfolk
part of body
the part of the body on which a person sits
part of trousers/pants
the part of a pair of trousers/pants that covers a person's seat
(fly) by the seat of your pants

data.chText: 临时凭感觉碰运气；凭经验瞎碰
data.enText: to act without careful thought and without a plan that you have made in advance, hoping that you will be lucky and be successful
be in the driving seat
be in the driver's seat

data.chText: 担任负责人；处于统领地位
data.enText: to be the person in control of a situation
take a back seat

data.chText: 允许他人领先；甘愿居于人下；退居幕后
data.enText: to allow sb else to play a more active and important role in a particular situation than you do
bums on seats

data.chText: 观众（或听众）的数量大（尤用于强调吸引大量观众的需要或愿望）
data.enText: used to refer to the number of people who attend a show, talk, etc., especially when emphasizing the need or desire to attract a large number

data.chText: 他们不在乎观众是什么样的人——只求卖座。
data.enText: They're not bothered about attracting the right audience─they just want bums on seats.
on the edge of your seat

data.chText: 异常兴奋；极为激动；有浓厚兴趣
data.enText: very excited and giving your full attention to sth

data.chText: 这场比赛使观众兴奋不已。
data.enText: The game had the crowd on the edge of their seats.
sit down

data.chText: 向…提供座位；（使）就座；坐；落座
data.enText: to give sb a place to sit; to sit down in a place
Please wait to be seated (= in a restaurant, etc.) .
Please be seated (= sit down) .
He seated himself behind the desk.

data.chText: 飞机停好以前，请坐着别动。
data.enText: Please remain seated until the aircraft has come to a halt.

data.chText: 这辆公共汽车能坐42名乘客。
data.enText: The bus can carry 42 seated passengers.
of building/vehicle
to have enough seats for a particular number of people
The aircraft seats 200 passengers.

ex.enText: He seated himself at the desk.

ex.chText: 我们请那位来宾坐在主席的右边。
ex.enText: We seated the guest to the right of the chairman.

synonyms.bx: 通常后接反身代词表示使某人自己就座，或后接某人表示安排其就座。

ex.chText: 我们坐在酒吧的几个高脚凳上。
ex.enText: We perched ourselves on a couple of high stools at the bar.
Bobby perched himself on the edge of the bed.

ex.chText: 她爸爸过去常让她坐在自行车前梁上。
ex.enText: Her father used to perch her on the front of his bike.

synonyms.bx: 表示此义时，通常用于 perch (sb/oneself) on sth 结构。

ex.chText: 别只是坐着看，来帮帮我!
ex.enText: Don't just sit watching, come and help me!

ex.chText: 在公共汽车上我们坐在一起。
ex.enText: On the bus we sat together.
She was sitting by the window, reading a novel.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，与 stand (站) 相对，常用于口语。

ex.zh: 空座位；空缺的席位（或职位）
腾出来的座位；空出来的席位（或职位）

data.enText: (fly) by the seat of your pants

data.chText: 临时凭感觉碰运气；凭经验瞎碰
data.enText: to act without careful thought and without a plan that you have made in advance, hoping that you will be lucky and be successful
be in the driving seat
be in the driver's seat

data.chText: 担任负责人；处于统领地位
data.enText: to be the person in control of a situation
take a back seat

data.chText: 允许他人领先；甘愿居于人下；退居幕后
data.enText: to allow sb else to play a more active and important role in a particular situation than you do
bums on seats

data.chText: 观众（或听众）的数量大（尤用于强调吸引大量观众的需要或愿望）
data.enText: used to refer to the number of people who attend a show, talk, etc., especially when emphasizing the need or desire to attract a large number

data.chText: 他们不在乎观众是什么样的人——只求卖座。
data.enText: They're not bothered about attracting the right audience─they just want bums on seats.
on the edge of your seat

data.chText: 异常兴奋；极为激动；有浓厚兴趣
data.enText: very excited and giving your full attention to sth

data.chText: 这场比赛使观众兴奋不已。
data.enText: The game had the crowd on the edge of their seats.

tr: any support where you can sit (especially the part of a chair or bench etc. on which you sit)
example: he dusted off the seat before sitting down

tr: furniture that is designed for sitting on
example: there were not enough seats for all the guests

tr: the cloth covering for the buttocks
example: the seat of his pants was worn through

tr: a part of a machine that supports or guides another part
the legal right to sit as a member in a legislative or similar body
example: he was elected to a seat in the Senate

tr: the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on
example: he deserves a good kick in the butt
are you going to sit on your fanny and do nothing?

tr: the location (metaphorically speaking) where something is based
example: the brain is said to be the seat of reason

tr: a space reserved for sitting (as in a theater or on a train or airplane)
example: he booked their seats in advance
he sat in someone else's place

tr: a center of authority (as a city from which authority is exercised)

example: The host seated me next to Mrs. Smith

tr: place in or on a seat
example: the mother seated the toddler on the high chair

tr: place or attach firmly in or on a base
example: seat the camera on the tripod

tr: put a seat on a chair
place ceremoniously or formally in an office or position
example: there was a ceremony to induct the president of the Academy

value.def: A seat is an object that you can sit on, for example a chair.

example.tran: 斯蒂芬回到自己的座位上。

example.ex: Ann could remember sitting in the back seat of their car.
example.tran: 安记得坐在他们车里的后排座上了。

value.def: The seat of a chair is the part that you sit on.

example.ex: The stool had a torn, red plastic seat.
example.tran: 那个凳子的红色塑料座面已经破旧不堪。

value.def: If you seat yourself somewhere, you sit down.

example.ex: He waved towards a chair, and seated himself at the desk.
example.tran: 他挥手指了指一把椅子，自己在书桌旁坐了下来。

example.ex: ...a portrait of one of his favourite models seated on an elegant sofa.
example.tran: 一幅他最喜欢的模特之一的画像，画中人坐在雅致的沙发上

value.def: A building or vehicle that seats a particular number of people has enough seats for that number.

example.tran: 那个剧院可容纳 570 人。

value.def: The seat of a piece of clothing is the part that covers your bottom.

example.ex: Then he got up and brushed off the seat of his jeans.
example.tran: 然后他站起来，拍了拍牛仔裤的臀部。

value.def: When someone is elected to a parliament, congress, or senate, you can say that they, or their party, have won a seat .

example.ex: Independent candidates won the majority of seats on the local council.
example.tran: 无党派候选人在地方议会选举中赢得了多数席位。

example.ex: ...a Maryland Republican who lost his seat.
example.tran: 一名失掉席位的马里兰州共和党党员

value.def: If someone has a seat on the board of a company or on a committee, they are a member of it.

example.ex: He has been unsuccessful in his attempt to win a seat on the board of the company.
example.tran: 他始终未能如愿以偿地在公司董事会中谋得一席之地。

value.tran: (公司董事会、委员会中的)席位，职位

value.def: The seat of an organization, a wealthy family, or an activity is its base.

example.ex: Gunfire broke out early this morning around the seat of government in Lagos.
example.tran: 今天凌晨在拉各斯的政府大楼周围发生了枪战。

example.ex: ...Weston Park, family seat of the Earl of Bradford.
example.tran: 韦斯顿公园，布拉德福德伯爵的祖宅

value.tran: (组织、活动的)中心地，所在地;(豪门的)宅邸

value.def: If you take a back seat, you allow other people to have all the power and to make all the decisions.

example.ex: You need to take a back seat and think about both past and future...
example.tran: 你得退居二线，把过去和将来都捋清楚。

example.ex: This is a country where women usually take a back seat.
example.tran: 在这个国家通常是男尊女卑。

value.tran: 让权于他人;退居次要位置

value.def: If you take a seat, you sit down.

example.ex: 'Take a seat,' he said in a bored tone...
Rachel smiled at him as they took their seats on opposite sides of the table.
example.tran: 他们分坐在桌子两边，雷切尔对他微微笑了一下。

xrse.def: by the seat of your pants

trans: (可安装在汽车上的)儿童安全座椅；汽车座位
(房间内窗下的)靠窗的座位,窗座；(火车、巴士或飞机上的)靠窗的座位
阀座环；座环；阀座；环座；座圈
让权于他人;退居次要位置
座套；座椅套；盖板；椅套；椅罩
处于控制地位，掌握控制权
